column1: '''A.F. Colborn''' was a B.Litt student at [[University of Oxford#St Edmund Hall|St Edmund Hall
column3: under [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s supervision. Tolkien was appointed supervisor on [[30 October]] [[1931]] and Colborn was admitted on [[4 December]].<ref group=note>His surname is spelt "Colburn" in the published ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide]]: I. Chronology'' ((2006). However
column4: [http://www.abebooks.com/servlet/SearchResults?an=A.F.+Colborn&kn=Hali+Meidhad sales of his book] reveal that his name appears to have been spelt "Colborn". The latter spelling is also used in Bella Millett's ''Annotated Bibliographies of Old and Middle English: II. Ancrene Wisse
